name: Chinese Chicken and Corn Soup
description: Recipe video above. This is a very quick to make soup that is one of all my all time favourites, it's thick, creamy (but with no cream!), sweet from the corn, hearty and soul warming. I've been known to add greens to it, my favourite being chinese broccoli and broccolini, to make it a complete meal. Though this recipe is made with chicken, it is easily made vegetarian/vegan by omitting the chicken. Watch the cooking videoto see how this is made without using a chopping board!
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp soy sauce ((all purpose or light))
1 tbsp Chinese cooking wine (OR Mirin or Dry Sherry (can omit))
1 tsp ginger (, minced or finely chopped)
1  garlic clove (, minced or finely chopped)
1 tsp cornflour / cornstarch (, mixed with a splash of cold water)
Salt and white pepper (, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Place broth, creamed corn, soy sauce, Chinese cooking wine, ginger, garlic and cornflour / water mixture in a saucepan over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Place broth, creamed corn, soy sauce, Chinese cooking wine, ginger, garlic and cornflour / water mixture in a saucepan over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to boil, then turn down the heat to medium and stir occasionally. Cook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to boil, then turn down the heat to medium and stir occasionally. Cook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened.

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust seasoning with salt, turn off heat, and slowly whisk in the egg so it cooks in "ribbons" throughout the soup. This also thickens the soup.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust seasoning with salt, turn off heat, and slowly whisk in the egg so it cooks in "ribbons" throughout the soup. This also thickens the soup.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken, season with white pepper, and serve, garnished with scallions.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chicken, season with white pepper, and serve, garnished with scallions.

review.reviewBody:
Made this at school A+
Any suggestions of stuff I can add
I just had to give this 5 stars! So good!
...this was SO easy to make and  so INCREDIBLY delish!
Made this tonight as had some cooked chook leftover. Wow what a great easy recipe. Me thinks this is going to be a very regular thing in our home

Another amazing recipe. Such a comforting soup, perfect for these cold rainy nights in Sydney at the moment. Super easy and quick to make, with very little prep and very little cleaning up. I used the Foolproof poaching chicken breast recipe to cook the chicken and shredded it with forks to add into my corn soup. Will definitely be making this soup again through winter!

Love it when winter arrives here in Australia so I can start making this divine soup again!  It's probably sacrilege but I also add a generous teaspoon of normal curry powder (Keens et al) into it - totally not Chinese but I don't care, it gives it a lovely bite and more warmth :-)

OMG! Our Little Miss is feeling under the weather and needing something comforting and easy to eat,let me say this recipe was Absolutely On! It also took me way back to my childhood of Saturday night chinese takeaway as this was Always my favourite and tastes exactly the same..Thankyou sooo very much for this incredibly comforting and fuss free recipe ðŸ’•ðŸ’•ðŸ’•
Thanks Nagi! My older daughter loves this soup from our local take-out restaurant. We all have colds right now so Iâ€™ll will be making this for dinner to clear our sinuses and warm our bellies!
My husband and I eat this at least once a month! We also add a dash of sweet chilli sauce, and sometimes bok choy if we have it on hand.
Absolutely delicious, perfect for a weekday meal when you need something quick. Has all the flavours of a soup thatâ€™s been stewing for hours.
Absolutely beautiful, especially with a bit of sesame oil to serve! I'm glad I tried this last week cause now I sick with covid and it's the best medicine. With a bit of extra garlic.

Made this tonight as not feeling the best. I poached the chicken earlier today as per your Poached Chicken recipe. This was so easy to make and very tasty. Really enjoyed the hint of the ginger coming through the dish. Will make again.
I have made this soup several times and loved it. This time, instead of drizzling with sesame oil, I garnished with chilli crisp. It was amazing!
So easy to make! I was out of the kitchen in 10 mins! I diced up chicken thigh as I didnâ€™t have cooked chicken and boiled it in. Yummy!
I love this recipe. Iâ€™ve made it numerous times and always turns out perfect.
Such a quick recipe and it's delicious every single time!!
